author: joshf
title: Cardano Kiosk | Hub-in-a-box
description: The large capital requirements for a brick-and-mortar community hub are prohibitive to wide scale adoption.

author: joshf
title: Cardano Hubs Directory
description: Community hubs lack the visibility needed in order to attract new members, connect with each other and share resources.

author: headelf
title: C4S - Cardano for Seniors Hubs
description: Senior Citizens learn differently than other age groups and have been slow to adopt Defi. How do we engage a Worldwide population to ADA?

author: twomin
title: 2Min Review by Voice for Busy Voter
description: There is a challenge for busy voters to catch the increasing information of proposals, affecting the development of the Cardano Community

author: baxter30
title: Blockchain Learning Center + Coffee
description: People need access to high quality information about blockchain technology. Fun approachable ways to learn are hard to find.

author: vcoincheck
title: Knowledge hub for Vietnam and Japan
description: Cardano originates from Japan and has a lot of ADA holders but the problem is the level of engagement with the int' community is still low.

author: tienna
title: Townhall Channel in Vietnamese
description: Strategy info from the weekly Cardano Townhall has not promptly reached the majority of Vietnamese and avoid mis/disinformation.

author: habacef
title: Community Berlin as a franchise
description: Cardano communities are not well structured. And till now no local communties organize themselves regularly.

author: swhitenstall
title: Funded Proposer Sub-Circle
description: Proposers funded by Catalyst lack a collaborative layer to answer FAQ questions, leave feedback, and raise and discuss issues / problems.

author: nvhieu
title: Cardano Coffee lounge in Vietnam
description: Need to diversify learning methods and exchange knowledge with experienced devs and Cardanian in Vietnam

author: otaviolima
title: Cardano Kids Educational ComicBook
description: Children need to learn and be nurtured in different ways, so how do you prepare them for the decentralized, blockchain and crypto future?

author: oshomah
title: Plutus for Nigerian Universities
description: Nigerian computer science degrees fall short of the requirements to solve current blockchain problems. An opportunity for a solution arises.

author: otaviolima
title: Exhibit Largest Blockchain LATAM BR
description: Only a few Brazilian and LATAM companies know Cardano as a main Blockchain. Difficulty in adopting Cardano (ADA) in the real business world.

author: dimitri777
title: Kandy Community Hub
description: There is no hub in Kandy

author: antoine
title: Cardano Hub Caracas
description: Crypto mass adoption is happening now in Venezuela, out of necessity. Cardano should establish a greater prensence in local communities.

author: ayaxlabombarda
title: Innovatio Digital HUB
description: Physical HUBs limit the participation of community members in specific cities and local spaces, leaving many digital users outside.

author: konmaorg
title: Mesh Network-Konma Xperience Center
description: Learning centers are boring! Imagine an Xperience center instead that shows real-world examples of using Blockchain technology!

author: matt.artano
title: Cardano Baltic Startup Hub
description: There are countless blockchain startups in the Baltics, the "new San Francisco", there is no active Cardano community in the region.

author: john.afrane
title: A LIBRARY FACILITY AT MEDIE
description:
The Medie Community don’t have a convenient place to study after school hours.
The people also have no idea about cardano blockchain .

author: carlhenryglobal
title: CardanoCommunityHubs.com Worldwide
description: The successful global adoption of Cardano & ₳DA depends on exclusivity and building utility - We need more project led Hubs!

author: ditcameroon
title: French Haskell + Plutus Curriculum
description:
--
Haskell/Plutus French curriculum is non existent for central and west Africa developers. This is a drastic road block to adoption

author: cornl
title: Cardano Center Poland Live
description: There is a real need of live crypto events in Poland. Let's popularize our favourite ecosystem together under Cardano Center Poland brand!

author: cornl
title: Cardano Center Poland stage 2 - SPO
description: Cardano Community Hubs like Cardano Center Poland should become self-sufficient at possibly early stage for continuous independent growth.

author: thenoetherprotocol
title: Science Hub in Argentina
description: There are no specific hubs to connect Argentina's scientific talent with the Cardano ecosystem and its multiple possibilities.

author: rivenbark
title: The ADA Cafe Grows Cardano
description: We need to strengthen the existing community while simultaneously making Cardano more accessible and easy to onboard net-new people.

author: ampercy
title: Uganda Business & Technical Hub
description: There is a need to create a collaborative space to educate, train developers & entrepreneurs in order to foster Cardano-based solutions.

author: kuni
title: Automated Multilingual Tool
description: Marketing in a world that aims for Web 3.0 relies on "manual-work and trust" and is not scalable.

author: fractalfuzion
title: Cardano Stonerz Club Community Hub!
description: The Cardano Stonerz Club is already a valued Cardano community Hub. We would like to scale up to increase its outreach in the community.

author: sabrinaliu47
title: Cardano Hub TAIWAN
description: The Cardano community in Taiwan is limited, and most people, especially university students, have little knowledge about crypto or Cardano.

author: cardanochina
title: China Info Hub Continued- Dumpling
description: The Cardano Chinese-speaking community has been forming nicely since F4. Continue the work to keep educating the Chinese-speakers globally

author: ranket
title: Project Support Stake pool in Japan
description: Due to TAX problem in Japan, some ADA holder stopped Staking. On the other hands, there is many possibility and issue around Cardano spread.

author: quangtran
title: Haskell Course for Vietnamese
description: There are many developers who are very interested in building projects on Cardano but there are not any Haskell courses in Vietnamese.

author: yangkehua
title: Cardano Blockchain Buenos Aires Hub
description: The Cardano Community in Argentina is growing potentially everyday, presential events will stronger the multi-interaction in our Community

author: shirogat
title: Scale: Nationwide Innovation Hubs
description: Working with one hub at a time will take too long to achieve what is needed to scale. There is an existing infrastructure of hubs for scale

author: furrysparkle
title: MADAO New Mexico Ambassador program
description: MADAO needs to move past a cold-start problem within our eCommerce platform.

author: mostafa
title: USA East Coast Cardano CommunityHub
description: There are 500+ Colleges, and 9,000+ IT companies in the NorthEastern US, and no Community Hub. How can we reach this market in the best way?

author: shuwaku
title: Exhibit Largest BlockChainEXPO(JP)
description: Only few JP and East Asia companies recognize Cardano as main BLOCKCHAIN! so, it is difficult to adopt CARDANO into the real business world.

author: cardanokombat
title: Cardano Kombat Education Alliance
description: Individuals that are new to cryptocurrency are often misguided, lost and sometimes taken advantage of from bad actors in the ecosystem.

author: ldjatsa
title: French West Africa Outreach
description: There is no Cardano community in the French West Africa. People lack awareness of the blockchain solutions. Cardano could gain more grounds.

author: defidiscussions
title: Networking Events LatAm EXT
description: Our team wants onboard more countries in LatAm to contribute more skills and diverse ideas to the Project Catalyst community and cardano

author: jessec
title: Carnivilla Market Space
description: Cardano lacks engaging communal marketing spaces that represent projects, developers, and academia in order to onboard the general populace.

author: algaetoken
title: Sustainable Solution Hub
description: The community generally lack education on alternative options for positive choices on Cardano that benefit their lives and the environment

author: captainhaiti
title: #CardanoBeach; ADA's city in Miami
description: How can Cardano empower Miami locals to save their community from Climate Gentrification?

author: dan.mercurius
title: 🛫 On-Boarding ALL stakeholders
description: Cardano community sees Catalyst as a separate entity, thus many stakeholders are neither on-boarded nor engaged.

author: afia
title: Cardano Information Centre
description: Cardano/Catalyst related materials are not localized for the African context, access to such materials is not known to majority of Africans

author: jaaf
title: Cardano Hub-Complex Setup
description: Lack of exposure leaves young entrepreneurs and students not able to capitalize on their backgrounds to get introduced to Cardano.

author: setyotomo
title: Cardano Hub Indonesia-Video Series
description: Indonesians prefer simple visual infographics through videos to learn about Cardano in local language - Bahasa Indonesia

author: callyfromauron
title: Liverpool Cardano Philosophy Hub
description: There is a lack of philosophical discussion at community level about Cardano, so an opportunity to engage people is being missed.

author: jdavid
title: Cardano Hub in Guam, USA
description: Guam, USA is where America's day begins. There is little awareness of Cardano in this beautiful island.

author: xeeban
title: SalmonNation Decentralized Alliance
description: The Salmon Nation bioregion needs a hub to connect people to collaborate on blockchain solutions for challenges in this area of the world.

author: tadatek
title: TADATek Insights
description: Our mission is to bring the most comprehensive knowledge about Cardano to the community in Vietnam.

author: fimi.vn
title: FIMI-Vietnamese Cardano Talk
description: How to raise awareness among Vietnamese about Cardano so that it can be adopted into real life in 2022 and after that?

author: easterntownhall
title: Eastern Town Hall Team Operation
description: Participating in Catalyst is difficult when you live in the Eastern Hemisphere Time zones where English is not the main language.

author: jerrybnj
title: Model ICT Hub for Deprived Students
description: How can we motivate deprived young students in the North East region of Ghana to get educated in the present and coming technologies?

author: nicks45589
title: Go-Peds Go-Cardano
description: For blockchain to achieve global adoption, we need to start educating the next generation now. But how can you make kids interested in it?

author: npaquoc87
title: Cardano Incredible Race - 2022
description: Cardano Community in Vietnam is lacking of social events. We need to make Cardano community more visible and create impact to new people.

author: emerson
title: Australian University Cardano Talks
description: Cryptocurrency and blockchain development is not a common topic in universities, with most having no exposure to Cardano.

author: romanshape
title: Marketplace for Artists
description: It is hard to enter and use the blockchain. The learning curve is not steep, meaning, it takes a lot of time to understand very little

author: checkpoint
title: Checkpoint Content Hub
description: Despite all the great things the Cardano blockchain, there are few solutions to the acquisition, retention and servicing of audiences

author: adamrusch
title: IRI: Champaign Cardano Meetups
description: Cardano needs more community activities that allow users to meet and network.

author: cardano4climate
title: C4C Community Hub Operations
description: Cardano4climate builds and participates since fund 6 in building the Cardano Ecosystem without ensured and sustainable access to resources

author: cryptonian1234
title: Blockchaindiary Education Hub
description: Blockchain and Cardano aren't easy to understand and learn. Everybody responds best to a certain way of getting things explained that varies

author: cardanoamigos
title: Bilingual Web3 Tech + Arts Space
description: The job market is shrinking and being automated. Hispanics will account for 20% of workforce by 2030 yet currently hold 3% of tech jobs.

author: rivenbark
title: Growing Cardano’s Ecosystem
description: Cardano users and projects need trusted, reliable sources to learn from and connect with other Community Members.

author: harry.hellyer
title: Community Hubs Impact Accelerator
description: Community Hubs are often seen as charitable causes as the Value they deliver: Cultural & Commercial, Short & Long term is hard to quantify

author: jlcheetah
title: Living Waters Costa Rica
description: Many projects focus on technology education; we need working models in the regenerative space applying the possibilities of cryptocurrency.

author: accelerate2030
title: Cardano Community in Geneva
description: Cardano can greatly benefit from visibility in the Geneva ecosystem, but increased awareness, credibility and enhanced networks are needed.

author: lucyjiang
title: Oxford Student Hub
description: Cardano lacks community awareness and needs more developers. Lack of quality articles explaining Cardano and the ecosystem.
